Where to begin... OK - let me start at the beginning. Tyler responds almost within seconds, any time you ask questions. The check-in process was easy peasy.

Tyler is a Delphi guy who loves his community, and it really shows in the photos and artwork by local artists displayed in his house. In addition, he has an extensive collection of books about local history which he offers in the lovely library. You can't help but feel the history of this small town.
Which brings me to the second "plus:" this gorgeous historic home sits among many gorgeous (or becoming gorgeous or potentially gorgeous) historic homes. Sit on the front porch and look across the street at the transformation going on at a Victorian mansion and at a beautiful example of mid-century limestone ranch homes situated on a 3-acre wooded lot. Walk around the neighborhood and see example after example of classic architecture.
Delphi is a lovely historic town with many attractions - the Opera House and Gallery, the Wabash and Erie Canal Center, the Historic Hiking Trails, Riley Park, Deer Creek; and Sterling House is a perfect home base for exploring and getting a feel for this charming community. I definitely will return to Sterling House (and I'll bring friends!). I highly highly recommend it. Well done, Tyler.
